item.title: Dauntless to end service on May 30
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/dauntless-to-end-service-on-may-30

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

No additional content or updates planned.

Free-to-play monster hunting game Dauntless will end service on May 29 at 11:45 p.m. PT / May 30 at 2:45 a.m. ET, after which it will no longer be available to play, developer Phoneix Labs announced.

Dauntless first launched for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC on September 26, 2019, followed by Switch on December 10, 2019, and PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on December 2, 2021.

A major update, “Umbral Reign,” was planned for release on January 16, but was delayed to an unannounced date. However, Phoenix Labs announced today that Dauntless will receive no additional content or updates.

item.title: Woodo ‘Story’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/woodo-story-trailer

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

A heartwarming and cozy puzzle adventure.

Publisher Daedalic Entertainment and developers Yullia Prohorova and Timur Bogotof have released the story trailer for 3D puzzle game Woodo.

Here is an overview of the game, via Daedalic Entertainment:

About

Woodo is a cozy 3D puzzle game based on simple diorama assembly mechanics with a beautiful visual style. The game is like a tiny constructor from your childhood, immersing players in a peaceful, safe and creative world.

3D Puzzle

The game mechanics are simple: The player assembles small scenes of a big wooden world piece by piece, following the story told by the narrator.

Coziness

One of our goals is to convey a feeling of warmth, empathy and comfort through our game, transforming it from a puzzle game into a way to help people feel better. The game is simple on the surface but helps to convey the instincts of love and safety to someone that needs it to get through another day. A game that heals and supports like a hot tea with grandmother in front of a fireplace.

Story

The main purpose of the game is to immerse the player in memories of their childhood, in those feelings of an open and vast world, when time was plentiful and most of it was spent outdoors, when the simplest things surprised and when every day could be a great adventure.

Woodoo is in development for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC (Steam). A release date has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

Story Trailer

item.title: Ratatan ‘Gameplay’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/ratatan-gameplay-trailer

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Latest look at the rhythmic roguelike action game.

Publisher Game Source Entertainment and developers TVT and Ratata Arts have released a new gameplay trailer for rhythmic roguelike action game Ratatan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Game Source Entertainment:

Ratatan is a game that combines rhythm and side-scroller action, supporting up to four players in online cooperative gameplay. Players defeat enemies by sending commands through dynamic and passionate music to the Cobuns, making for an enjoyable adventure with thrilling battles intertwined with rhythm and action.

Ratatan is a rhythmic roguelike action game, developed in collaboration between Hiroyuki Kotani, the game designer of the renowned series PATAPON, released on PSP in 2007, and Tokyo Virtual Theory (TVT). Players act as the Ratatan, using magical instruments to deliver different commands to the armies of Cobun to attack the enemies.

In addition to attack and defence rhythmic sequences, there are also actions that allow the Ratatan to move freely, with unique skills for each character, further deepening the musicality of the game. Players will enter “fever mode” when they accurately follow the rhythm sequences. In fever mode, the background music changes interactively, and characters perform various actions.

Ratatan also incorporates the popular Roguelike system. In each adventure, Ratatan and its Cobun randomly receive different power-ups and rewards in every battle. Players will experience different adventures each time, with various power-ups bringing various diverse effects and increasing gameplay possibilities.

With Nelnal as the game illustrator and character designer, RATATAN features richer game graphics and more characters than before. It has also added a lot of new content, including a brand new system and mini games for multiplayers. It will utilize TVT’s own “Theory Engine” to provide a fast and stable environment for online multiplayer.

Ratatan is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2025.

Watch the trailer below.

Gameplay Trailer

item.title: Outbound adds Xbox Series version, launches in 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/outbound-adds-xbox-series-version-launches-in-2026

  • PC
  • Xbox Series

Open-world camper van exploration game confirmed for console.

Open-world camper van exploration game Outbound will launch for Xbox Series alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version in 2026, publisher Silver Lining Games and developer Square Glade Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Outbound is an open-world exploration game set in a utopian near future. You start with an empty camper van and turn it into the home of your dreams. Build and explore at your own pace. Scavenge materials, craft, automate production, and build in and on top of your vehicle with modular parts. Advance in technology and efficiently use energy to power your home. Adjust your strategy to adapt to new landscapes and changing environmental conditions.

Key Features

  • Source Energy – Fuel your electric camper van with energy from the sun, wind, or water.
  • Build – Build your moving base with a modular building system. Customize your vehicle with paint, decorations, and furniture to create your own perfect cozy place.
  • Grow – Create gardens to nurture delicate and delicious plants and mushrooms. Eat them raw or cook them first to refill your needs.
  • Craft and Automate – Craft workstations and tools from resources around you. Upgrade, connect, and automate to produce more complex parts.
  • Explore – Explore a colorful open world with a variety of biomes, resources, and secrets to uncover.

Watch a new trailer below.

Xbox Series Announce Trailer

item.title: Echo Weaver adds Xbox Series, Xbox One versions
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/echo-weaver-adds-xbox-series-xbox-one-versions

  • PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Also available via Xbox Game Pass.

“Fast-paced metroidBRAINia” will launch for Xbox Series Xbox One alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version in 2025, publisher Akupara Games and developer Moonlight Kids announced. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“We set out for the stars in search of paradise. We found something else…”

Echo Weaver is a fast-paced metroidBRAINia that tells the tale of a ruined society trapped in a fatal time loop. Uncover their story—and your own—as you explore what remains. Use each loop to chip away at the mystery, exploring beautifully drawn biomes, helping quirky survivors, and tracking down leads.

Fine-tune your skills to blaze through new routes, harvest potent “echoes,” and unlock game-altering secrets and shortcuts. Gain powerful knowledge to reshape the timeline and master the loop, weaving a new fate for all those trapped within.

When faced with eternity, knowledge is the only gear you need.

Key Features

  • Explore a living, handcrafted world bound to the tick of the loop.
  • Experience the joy of traversal with fluid, seamless platforming for all.
  • Unfold a deep, rich narrative filled with quirky characters and wily motivations.
  • Collect powerful “echoes” to aid your quest and honor those who came before.
  • Discover countless game-breaking secrets and shortcuts to master the loop.

Watch a new trailer below.

Xbox Announce Trailer

item.title: TRON: Catalyst launches June 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/tron-catalyst-launches-june-17

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Story-driven isometric action adventure game dated.

Story-driven isometric action adventure game TRON: Catalyst will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on June 17, publisher Big Fan Games and developer Bithell Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Big Fan Games:

About

TRON: Catalyst pulls you back into the world of Disney’s TRON to battle multiple opposing factions in the latest imaginative story from Bithell Games (Thomas Was Alone, Subsurface Circular, TRON: Identity). TRON: Catalyst is an all-new story-driven, isometric action adventure game, set in the immersive and diverse locations of the Arq Grid introduced in TRON: Identity.

Play as Exo, a highly resilient and resourceful program wielding an unexpected power known as the Glitch, gaining strength and abilities which the overlords of the Arq Grid’s crumbling society seek to bring under control. Ride Light Cycles, engage in Identity Disc combat, and more as you’re relentlessly pursued through the city and beyond by Conn, a malevolent program with an agenda of his own, while uncovering more about the glitches that threaten the stability of this world.

Key Features

  • Dynamic Combat System – Battle a legion of fearsome enemy programs in melee and ranged combat, both on-foot and while riding a Light Cycle. Master advanced techniques like parrying and Disc kicks to gain the upper hand, while exploring the Arq Grid and collecting Data Shards to upgrade your code base with new abilities.
  • Immersive New Story – Dive into an original TRON storyline. Meet the programs of the Arq Grid, uncover their secrets and fight to survive in a chase across the city and outlands. Playing as Exo, a courier working in this grid’s capital city, your life is turned upside down when a mysterious package explodes, granting you powers beyond any program’s normal function. With the Arq Grid’s ruthless ‘peacekeepers’ in hot pursuit, you’ll unlock the mysteries of this grid, and learn what kind of hero it needs you to become.
  • Exploit The Glitch – The Arq Grid is losing stability. Glitches roll back the clock, catching the world in a series of system level time loops… and only you can see them. Utilize Exo’s unique ability to uncover secret areas and shortcuts, and influence the factions jostling for control over the Arq Grid.
  • Authentic World of TRON – Explore the neon-lit streets of the Arq Grid on foot or Light Cycle, and navigate your way through the intriguing—often dangerous—characters that inhabit this high-stakes world. Travel through a diverse Grid filled with intriguing stories within a budding revolution all set to an immersive soundtrack from composer Dan Le Sac (TRON: Identity). If you’re a fan of Disney’s TRON, get ready to step into the universe you love like never before. If you’re new to this story, prepare for a thrilling adventure.

Now… finish the game.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: Jump Ship launches in Early Access this summer for Xbox Series, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/jump-ship-launches-in-early-access-this-summer-for-xbox-series-pc

  • PC
  • Xbox Series

Mission-based cooperative first-person shooter from former Hazelight, Mojang, and Coffee Stain Studios developers.

Mission-based cooperative first-person shooter Jump Ship will launch in Early Access for Xbox Series and PC via Steam this summer, publisher Coffee Stain Publishing and developer Keepsake Games announced. Sign-ups for the closed beta test are available here.

“Our goal was to create a game that balances the fun and immersion of space exploration,” said Keepsake Games CEO Daniel Kaplan in a press release. “Coming from Hazelight, Mojang, and Coffee Stain, we understand how to make a great co-op game, and we’ve reached a point where player input is vital in order for us to make Jump Ship as good as it can be. That’s why we’re releasing into Early Access this summer—to work directly with our players, listen to their feedback, and combine it with our vision.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Coffee Stain Publishing:

Jump Ship is a mission based co-op FPS in which players can transition seamlessly from crewing their very own space ship to on-foot exploration and space walks. The goal of each mission is to survive with the crew’s ship intact and make the next jump, picking up valuable resources, blueprints and weapons along the way. While one crewmate is piloting the ship, another might be putting out fires or fixing radiation leaks on the deck, while the rest of the group boards enemy vessels or battle through volatile space stations to make off with precious supplies.

In Jump Ship, the galaxy is filled with handcrafted celestial settings, from vast asteroid rings dominating the horizon to distant, luminescent nebulas radiating kaleidoscopic light. The scenery changes with each jump, as players go from boarding and pillaging a rival corvette-class ship to salvaging shipwrecks floating in vacuum or exploring an abandoned research facility.

However, deep space hides many other, more celestial threats, as solar flares and meteor showers regularly threaten to end players’ spacefaring journeys in an instant.

Watch a new set of trailers below.

Beta Launch Trailer

Gameplay Moments
